intro: Erigeron azureus, commonly known as blue fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features slender stems and narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically blue to purple in color, blooming in summer and attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron azureus is often found in open habitats like meadows and rocky areas, where it thrives in full sun.
